item.title: France, UK and Poland warn citizens on Israel, Iran as US aircraft surge in Saudi Arabia
item.summary: European nations issue travel alerts over escalation fears, while satellite images show a surge in US military aircraft at a key Saudi airbase and Washington signals readiness for possible strikes

item.title: New satellite images show US F-22 jets positioned on runway at southern Israel base
item.summary: Against Iran strike seeming imminent, Chinese satellite firm MizarVision continues to document US military aircraft movements in the region, publishing new imagery from Israel’s Ovda base, Qatar, Crete and Diego Garcia in the Indian Ocean

item.title: Fallen IDF soldier’s mother wins right to bring his child into the world
item.summary: After a four-year legal fight, the mother of Barel Hadaria Shmueli, killed by a Hamas gunman at the Gaza border in 2021, receives court approval for posthumous use of his sperm and is seeking a woman to conceive and raise the child with the family’s support

item.title: As US-Iran talks resume, Israel braces for possible American strike and Iranian retaliation
item.summary: As the talks in Geneva face possible collapse, Israeli officials assess that any American strike would trigger Iranian retaliation against Israel, with Hezbollah and the Houthis likely to join; the IDF strikes Radwan Force sites in Lebanon

item.title: IDF braces for possible Hezbollah showdown as US weighs strike on Iran
item.summary: Military says it has immediate operational plans along Lebanon border as officials assess risk of a multi-front conflict involving Hezbollah, Houthis in Yemen, Iraqi militias and Hamas in Gaza

item.title: US authorizes departure of nonessential staff from Israel
item.summary: State Department cites security risks, warns embassy may restrict travel to parts of Israel, Jerusalem’s Old City and the West Bank, and urges American citizens to consider leaving while commercial flights remain available; US ambassador urges staff to leave Israel ‘today’

item.title: Outrage as Haredi protesters set up ‘Hostages Square’ for detained draft dodgers
item.summary: In Modiin Illit, activists protesting arrest of ultra-Orthodox men who failed to report for military service erect 'Hostages Square' modeled on Tel Aviv’s plaza for Gaza captives, adopting hostage-family symbols

item.title: Rubio breaks tradition before Israel trip, urges envoys not to undermine Iran talks
item.summary: US secretary of state to visit Jerusalem without traveling press corps, as memo instructs diplomats to avoid comments that could inflame tensions or complicate nuclear negotiations with Tehran

item.title: Support for Israel hits historic low as Americans shift toward Palestinians, Gallup poll shows
item.summary: New polling shows US sympathy now tilts toward Palestinians for the first time in decades, with Democrats and young voters driving a dramatic political realignment after the Gaza war

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court freezes government move to expel aid groups from Gaza
item.summary: Justice Dafna Barak-Erez issues interim order blocking revocation of licenses over dispute about providing lists of Palestinian staff, citing a 'substantial legal disagreement' pending a full hearing
